category.nostalgic_tweaks.name: Nostalgic Tweaks
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.confirm.quit_body: Are you sure you want to quit editing? Changes will§c not§r be saved!
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.overlay.list.hint:
You can§b move§r around the list with§b Tab§r or §bShift + Tab§r.

You can also§e 'click'§r an entry with the§e enter§r or§e space bar§r key.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.overlay.color.hint: You can§e move§r each slider by§a one§r digit by scrolling up or down.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.overlay.filter.tool: Filter out tool items from the §bAll Items§r category.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.overlay.filter.bloc: Filter out block items from the §bAll Items§r category.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.overlay.filter.item: Filter out regular items from the §bAll Items§r category.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.overlay.defaults.me: When default entries are§a enabled§r, their values will be used. If an entry is included in§b Saved Entries§r and§e Default Entries§r, then the value in§b Saved Entries§r will be used.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.overlay.nuke.messag: Are you sure you want to§c delete§r all of your§b saved entries§r?
You have§c lost§r operator§e permissions§r while modifying this §6server side§r item list.

You can exit§c without§r saving or you can exit§a with§r saving to your §9client side§r item list.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.overlay.drag.@Toolt: You can click and drag this window when the title text is§e highlighted§r.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.settings.title: Nostalgic Tweaks
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.list.tutorial:
You can§e change§r or§c remove§r saved items in the§b Saved Entries§r category. To§a add§r an item, click on an item in the§b All Items§r category. You can§d search§r for an item in the §7input box§r above.

This §7search box§r will filter both categories.§e Item tag§r searching §7(e.g., #flowers)§r is only available when§a playing§r in a world.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.speed.@Prefi:
The higher the swing number is the slower the swinging animation will be.

§aAlpha/Beta Minecraft§f: §b8
§6Modern Minecraft§f: §b6

§rIf you are§e photosensitive§r, it is recommended to set speeds to§e 0§r.
To set§d customized§r speeds for individual items, click the§d Custom Speeds§r button below.
§r
Get a list of results based on§a likely§r relevance from§6 search words§r and§c misspellings§r.

§2Exact§r and§a highly§r relevant matches appear§e near the top§r of the results.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.state.bubble: Search for words within a tweak's tooltip speech bubble.
Reset the input that has been typed into the search box.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.state.tag.@T:
§2Add§r or§e cycle§r through all available search tags within the search box.

Any query input will be§d preserved§r when clicking.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.state.nuke.@: Delete all§b Saved Entries§r. A pop-up window will appear confirming this is what you want to do.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.state.filter: Open an overlay window with checkbox options that can further filter the§b All Items§r category.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.state.tag.li: Create a new saved entry from the item that is in your character's main hand.
Click this button to open an informative pop-up with swing speed data.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.status.wait:
This tweak has§c not§r been§e loaded§r yet. It is§4 impossible§r to detect if a mod conflict has occurred at this time.

§eLoad a world and check again.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.status.warn: This tweak is still in§6 development§r. It is possible you might run into§c bugs§r when this tweak is§a enabled§r.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.status.fail:
This tweak has encountered a mod§4 conflict§r or has§c not loaded§r.

For example, to§a load§e 2D floating items§r there§6 must§r be an§e item entity§r somewhere within the world.

§eNote:§c It is§4 impossible§c for this mod to automatically find conflicting mods.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.status.perm: To change this tweak you must be a server§e operator§r.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.status.net: Nostalgic Tweaks is§6 not installed§r on this server. Changing this tweak will have§c no§r effect.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.status.dynam: Nostalgic Tweaks is§6 not installed§r on this server. You can change this tweak.
Nostalgic Tweaks is§a installed§r on this server. As an§e operator§r you can change this tweak.
Nostalgic Tweaks is§a installed§r on this server. You§c cannot§r change this tweak.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.tag.new.@Too: This is a§c new§r tweak in this update.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.tag.client.@: This tweak is§e controlled§r by the§9 client§r.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.tag.server.@: This tweak is§e controlled§r by the§6 server§r.
This tweak is§e controlled§r by both the§9 client§r and§6 server§r.

Only servers with§a Nostalgic Tweaks§6 installed§r will§c override§r this tweak.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.tag.reload.@: Changing this option will§e reload§r your resource packs.
Some changes from this tweak§c cannot§r update unless the game is§4 restarted§r.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.tag.sync.@To: This binding is§d synced§r with the vanilla controls.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.tag.auto.@To: This binding is§a automatically saved§r when changed.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.tag.sodium.@: This tweak will§c not§r work when§b Sodium§r is installed.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.tag.optifine: This tweak will§c not§r work when§b Optifine§r is installed.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.alert.void: This tweak§c cannot§r be used when the§b old blue void override§r tweak is§a enabled§r.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.alert.light: The§c modern§r light colors will be §4incorrect§r when the§b old light rendering§r tweak is§a enabled§r. For example, the nighttime §9blue§r colors will look §6orange§r since§e skylight§r is replaced with§d block light§r.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.alert.shield: The§c modern§r shield position§c cannot§r be used when the §6old inventory§r tweak is§a enabled§r.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.search.inval: The search tag§9 %s§r is not valid.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.general.over:
This section will make§e changes§r to§a all§r configuration values. Use the§3 Disable All§r button to turn§4 off§r all mod tweaks. Use the§3 Enable All§r button to§2 reset§r all mod tweaks back to their§a default§r values.

You can§c cancel§r to§a undo§r any accidental edits.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.general.conf: Pick a configuration menu that will appear when the open config§e hot key§r is pressed. Exiting a configuration menu will still take you the mod's home screen.
Deactivate or change the§b color§r of the§7 tree lines§r that connect§d configuration entries§r with their corresponding§6 categories§r and§e subcategories§r.
Change different aspects of§7 row highlighting§r. You can completely§c disable§r highlighting,§c disable§r fade effects, or§6 change§r the§7 color§r.

If you do not wish to see tags next to tweak titles then uncheck the options below. If you are familiar with what each tag means next to a tweak title, then you can also disable their tooltips from appearing. Turning§c off§r tooltip tags will§4 not§r turn off§b speech bubble§r tooltips.

It is§4 impossible§r for the mod to automatically detect mod conflicts. The§e tweak§r [ §c!§r ] status symbol appears next to config entries that have§c not§r executed expected code. Sometimes, this status symbol is§c not§r 100% accurate and may require that a tweak be§a loaded§r first. For example, the§e old 2D items§r tweak will§c not§a load§6 until§r an§e item entity§r enters the world.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.general.sear: This section describes§e search tags§r that you can use in the§e search box§r. Each tag and what they do is described below.
§4@new §r- Find tweaks that are new for the current mod version you are playing on.
§c@conflict §r- Find tweaks that may be conflicting with another mod that you have installed.
§d@reset §r- Find tweaks that have been changed. Use the reset button to bring these tweaks back to their default state.
§b@client §r- Find tweaks that are controlled by the client.
§e@server §r- Find tweaks that are controlled by the server.
§a@save §r- Get a list of every tweak that can be saved.
§6@all §r- Get a list of every tweak in the mod.
gui.nostalgic_tweaks.config.general.shor: This section gives all keyboard shortcuts that can be used within this settings menu. Each shortcut and what they do is listed below.
§aSave§r:§2 §lCtrl + S §r- Saves and exits the config menu.

§dJump§r:§5 §lTab §r- Jump to the next row in the config menu.
Hold§5 §lShift + Tab§r to go in the§d opposite§r direction.
§6All§r:§e §lCtrl + A §r- Open a new window that lists all categories.

§bChange Group§r:§3 §lCtrl + Left§r §3or§l Right§r or§3 §lAlt + Left§r §3or§l Right §r
This will change which config group you are in.
§r

text.autoconfig.nostalgic_tweaks.title: Settings
Bring back the§a beta 1.8§r chest sounds.

All sounds are§e replaced§r with door open/close sounds.
Disable all chest sounds when opening or closing a chest.
Disable sounds when using a bone meal item.
Disable the placing sound when placing a door in the world.
Disable the placing sound when placing a bed in the world.
Disable all attack sounds like sweeping and critical hits.

Bring back the old 'oof' sounds when taking damage.

This only applies to player entities and will also disable custom player damage sounds such as drowning.
Bring back the old early 1.8 beta pickup sound for experience orbs.
Disable the experience orb pickup sounds.
Disable the experience level up sound.
Disable the unique footstep sounds for mobs. Sounds will be replaced by the block the mob is walking on.
§cIgnore§r bringing back old footstep sounds for entities§a added§r by§6 mods§r.
Fixes ambient occlusion for broken vanilla blocks such as composters and powdered snow.
Disables random offset positions for§e flower§r blocks.
Disables random offset positions for§a all§r blocks.
Bring back the full-sized chest block. This tweak also disables chest sounds and animations.

§cVisual Bug§r: Chest blocks will have bookshelf textures on the side if connected textures§r is§a on§r.

 Use§e F3 + T§r to reload mod textures§b after§r entering a world. To§c prevent§r doing this each game session, set §7Options > Video Settings > Quality > Connected Textures: §4OFF§r.
Bring back the full-sized chest voxel shape. This will inform the game to treat the chest as a full-sized block.

This tweak will§c change§r chest block interaction behavior.

When§6 toggling§r this tweak, you will need to§e optimize the world§r.

At the world selection screen, click the §bEdit§r button. Next, click the §bOptimize World§r button.

§cImportant§r, make sure you§a check§r the §dErase cached data§r option.

Lastly, click the §bCreate Backup and Load§r button.
Renders ender chests as full-sized blocks. This tweak also disables chest sounds, particles, and animations.
Renders trapped chests as full-sized blocks. This tweak also disables chest sounds and animations.
Bring back the full-bright torch model. This does§c not§r change the amount of light§e emitted§r.
Bring back the old parallelepiped wall torches.
Bring back the old parallelepiped redstone wall torches.
Make soul torches render as parallelepiped when attached to walls.
This option will apply the tweaks listed in this category to the title screen.
Removes the 60 FPS cap enforced on the main menu. The FPS defined in the user settings will be used.

Change the version text that appears in the top left of the title screen.

Use §b%v§r to insert the current game version. Use §b%§r followed by a Minecraft color code to get formatting. For example, §b%4§r will make §4red§r.
Remove the realms button from the title screen when the modern button layout is enabled.
Remove the accessibility button when the modern button layout is enabled.
Disable the language button from the modern or 1.0-1.7.9 button layouts.
Remove any mod loader information from the title screen.
Move the title text from top-left to bottom-left.
Bring back the old dirt background for the title screen.
Bring back the old§a alpha§r animated Minecraft logo on the title screen. If§c disabled§r, the resource pack logo will be used.
Disable the black outline around the static Minecraft logo.
Change the layout of the buttons on the title screen.
Add a§e Mods§r button to§a all§r old button layouts for the title screen.

Customize the overlay text that appears on the HUD when the§e old version overlay§r is§a enabled§r. Use §b%v§r to insert the current game version. Use §b%§r followed by a Minecraft color code to get formatting. For example, §b%4§r will make §4red§r.
Bring back the old Minecraft version overlay on the HUD.
Change the corner of the old version overlay text.
Bring back alpha, beta, or post-release game loading overlays.
Bring back the old world loading screens.
Remove the loading bar from the game loading overlay. This tweak does§c not§r modify the§6 modern§r loading overlay.
§cVisual Bug§r: The loading bar color will be§6 overridden§r when§b Optifine§r is installed.
Bring back the old chat input box. Adds a > at the beginning of the box.
Bring back the old chat box size, position, and fading animations.

Bring back the old button look. Text on buttons will have a slight§7 gray§r color. When hovering, the text turns §e yellow§r.

§bTo get the old§9 blue§b button background and§c removal§b of the§r white§b border around buttons, use a resource pack.
Bring back the old durability bar colors.
Disable the item name that appears above the hotbar when selecting an item.
Remove all text formatting from the item name that appears above the hotbar when selecting an item.
Start with a filled hotbar when joining a world with an empty inventory in creative mode.
Bring back the old pause menus throughout various versions of Minecraft.
Add a§e Mods§r button to§a every§r old pause screen layout.
Change the transparent color backgrounds when opening screens, like the inventory screen.
Override the old gui background by providing your own gradient colors.
Change the gradient color of the top part of the gui background.
Change the gradient color of the bottom part of the gui background.

Show entity identification numbers when the§e F3§r debug screen is active.

This tweak will§c not§r work on servers.
Bring back the old debug screen. §aAlpha§r has§c no§r coordinate information but§e Beta§r does.
Change the style of the FPS chart or turn it off.
Show the TPS chart when an old debugging screen is rendering.
Control whether the debugging pie chart appears in the old debugging screen.
Bring back the old semi-transparent black background for the FPS pie chart.
Show sky light and block light information. This tweak will separate Nostalgic Tweaks light and Minecraft light.
Show data about the block the cursor is pointing at.
Show data about the direction the player is facing.
Show information about the biome the player is in.
Show information about the amount of GPU usage (0%-100%) is being used.
When§a enabled§r, gives debug information text shadow.
When§a enabled§r, shows the background color behind debug information.
Change the background color that appears behind debug information.
Bring back the old tooltip boxes.
Disables tooltips from appearing when hovering over items in an inventory.
Show item enchantment information in hovered item tooltips.
Show item modifier information in hovered item tooltips.
Show dye color information in hovered item tooltips.
Bring back the old crafting table screen. This will change the position of the screen title text.
Disable or change the look of the recipe book button.
Bring back the old furnace screen. This will change the position of the screen title text for furnaces, blast furnaces, and smokers.
Disable or change the look of the recipe book button. This will make changes to furnaces, blast furnaces, and smoker screens.
Bring back the old inventory screen. This will change the crafting grid location and widen the player box.
Disable or change the look of the recipe book button.
Make the off-hand slot invisible or change its position. The§c Modern§r option will§c not§r work when the§e old inventory screen§r tweak is§a enabled§r.
Disable the overlay textures that appear in empty armor slots.
Disable the shield overlay icon that appears in an empty off-hand slot.
Bring back the old inverted lighting casted onto the player entity in the inventory screen.
Bring back the old inverted lighting casted onto blocks in the inventory screen.

Begin merging items into stacks when surrounding items become§e greater than or equal to§r the defined limit.

Having§a smaller§r limits provides§2 better§r FPS/TPS performance.

Set limit to§6 64§r to§c disable§r.
Disable item entities from merging. Use the§b item merging limit§r tweak to§c restrict§r this behavior.
Bring back the old item holding position.
Add, edit, and/or remove items that will be ignored by the old item holding tweak.
Bring back the old 2D floating item entities.
Bring back the old 2D items in item frames.
Simulate 2D items when throwing item entities like snowballs.
Flat, Sprite, Billboard, Snowball, Potion, Egg

Disable the enchantment glint on 2D floating items.

This will also disable enchantment glint for throwing items and items that are in item frames.
Only render the§e front face§r of item entities. All other faces will be§6 invisible§r. This will§a simulate§r old sprite rendering.
Bring back the old 2D colors for items that have custom colors like leather armor, potions, and spawn eggs.
Flat, Sprite, Billboard, Snowball, Potion, Egg, Armor
Fixes the transparent gaps seen in held item models.
Bring back the classic explosion particles for§a all§r explosions.
Bring back the§6 modern§r explosion particles§e mixed§r with the§a classic§r explosion particles.
Disable the particle animation that appears after attacking an entity with a sword.
Disables the damage indicator particles (§7the dark hearts§r) that appear when attacking entities.
Disables the critical hit particles that appear when attacking an entity.
Disables the enchantment hit particles that appear when attacking an entity.
Bring back the old non-transparent experience orbs.
Disable particles that are created after falling a great distance.
Disable particles that are created after using a bone meal item.
Disable particles that are created when the player is sprinting.
Disable particles that are created by§c Nether§r biomes.
Disable particles that are emitted by levers when activated.

Bring back the old calculation of explosion particles. This adds more particles during an explosion.

This may§c reduce§r FPS performance for explosions.
§cDisable§r the vanilla§e brightness§r settings from§6 impacting§b old light rendering§r.
§cDisable§r the flickering of light from§e light emitting§r sources.
Bring back the old light colors from alpha/beta. If this tweak is§c disabled§r and §7old light rendering§r is§a enabled§r then night light colors will be§6 inaccurate§r.
Bring back the old light rendering from alpha/beta. §eBlock light§r will be used instead of§b sky light§r. This will cause§6 round robin chunk updates§r during dawn/sunset.
This may§4 break§r some shaders. §6Decrease§r the block light slider in the shader subcategory if the world is too§e bright§r. §cDisable§r this tweak if you encounter further visual issues.
This may§4 break§r some shaders. §6Decrease§r the block light slider in the shader subcategory if the world is too§e bright§r. §cDisable§r this tweak if you encounter further visual issues.
Bring back the old smooth lighting from§e beta§r. This will §7darken§r the ambient occlusion casted around the§e edges§r of blocks.
Bring back the old Nether lighting. This will change the brightness and light shading directions in the §4Nether§r.
Bring back the old water lighting so that water blocks§e 3§r light levels instead of§6 1§r.
Bring back the old leaves lighting from§e beta§r. This will§c remove§r ambient occlusion casting on blocks that are§e next§r to leaves.
A §6shader§r control that determines how much§e block light§r is applied to the world. §cDecrease§r this number if§b old light rendering§r is§a enabled§r and the world is too§e bright§r.
Bring back the old name tag rendering for entities. This will make tags bigger as you move further away.
Replaces the disc chunk border with a square border.
Disable the change in sky color when the sun is rising or setting.
Bring back the old north/south sunrise/sunset. This also rotates the moon and sky fog.
Removes the custom fog color that is applied during a sunrise or sunset.

Bring back the old terrain fog rendering from alpha/beta.

Here are the old render distance types and their values,§a far§r:§2 16§r,§e normal§r:§6 8§r,§3 short§r:§b 4§r, and §5tiny: §d2§r.
Bring back the old horizon fog rendering from alpha/beta.
Bring back the old nether fog rendering from alpha/beta.
Change the sky color based on the selected version. This will also change the sky color in §4Nether§r biomes.
Change the fog color based on the selected version. This will also change the fog color in §4Nether§r biomes.
Change the cloud height (y-level). The old heights are;§a alpha§r y-§a108§r,§e beta§r y-§e128§r, and§6 modern§r y-§6192§r.
Bring back the old§l chunkier§r stars. §aAlpha§r has brighter stars and§e beta§r has§7 dimmer§r stars.
Bring back the old water fog density from alpha/beta.
Bring back the old water fog colors from alpha/beta. The§3 blue§r fog color will get§9 darker§r the deeper the player goes underwater.
Smoothly transition the density of water fog. This is most noticeable when a potion effect changes.
Smoothly transition the color of water fog. This is most noticeable when changing y-levels underwater.
Bring back the old§b blue§r void color in the far plane.
Overrides the dark void color when the player goes beneath the level's defined horizon height.
Changes the dark void's height position based on the player's y-level so the dark void will always start at the horizon. The blue void override tweak must be§c disabled§r for this to work.
Control whether cave/void fog is rendered. This tweak controls§a all§r void fog tweaks listed below.
Should cave/void fog render when the player is in creative mode.
Should void particles render when the player is in creative mode.
Change the color of cave/void fog. This tweak does§c not§r support alpha transparency.
Choose the y-level where cave/void fog starts changing the surrounding environment.
Set how much cave/void fog surrounds the player. Encroachment gets§e stronger§r as the player goes§6 deeper§r underground. A value of§a 100%§r is§2 full§r encroachment and§c 0%§r is§4 none§r.
Choose the y-level where void particles start rendering.
Change how far, in blocks, void particles will spawn around the player.
Change the density of void particles.
Allows emitted light from torches or blocks to remove encroaching cave/void fog.
Bring back the old bug that allowed players to continually climb when there is a single space between two ladders.
Bring back the old bug that allows players to milk squids.
Prevents sheep from eating grass blocks and regenerating their wool.
Disable animals from panicking when they receive damage.
Controls how many§e groups§r of animals can spawn around a player. A§a higher cap§r yields§a more§r animals.
Bring back the old animal spawning and removal logic. This will§c not§r remove saddled, leashed, tagged, or tamed animal entities.
Punching a sheep will drop the animal's wool as if it were sheared.
Only drop one wool block when a sheep is punched by a player.
Zombie Pigmen will§6 only§r drop§6 0-2§r cooked pork chops. §a+1§r for each level of looting. This will§c override§r data packs and§c disable§e rare drops§r.
Skeletons will§6 only§r drop§6 0-2§r bones and/or arrows. §a+1§r for each level of looting. This will§c override§r data packs and§c disable§e rare drops§r.
Chickens will§6 only§r drop§6 0-2§r feathers. §a+1§r for each level of looting. This will§c override§r data packs and§c disable§e rare drops§r.
Zombies will§6 only§r drop§6 0-2§r feathers. §a+1§r for each level of looting. This will§c override§r data packs and§c disable§e rare drops§r.
Spiders will§6 only§r drop§6 0-2§r string. §a+1§r for each level of looting. This will§c override§r data packs and§c disable§e rare drops§r.
Sheep will§c not§r drop anything when killed.
Cows will§6 only§r drop§6 0-2§r leather. §a+1§r for each level of looting. This will§c override§r data packs and§c disable§e rare drops§r.
Pigs will§6 only§r drop§6 0-2§r pork chops. §a+1§r for each level of looting. This will§c override§r data packs and§c disable§e rare drops§r.
Zombie villagers will§6 only§r drop§6 0-2§r feathers. §a+1§r for each level of looting. This will§c override§r data packs and§c disable§e rare drops§r.
Cave spiders will§6 only§r drop§6 0-2§r string. §a+1§r for each level of looting. This will§c override§r data packs and§c disable§e rare drops§r.
Mooshrooms will§6 only§r drop§6 0-2§r leather. §a+1§r for each level of looting. This will§c override§r data packs and§c disable§e rare drops§r.
Drowned zombies will§6 only§r drop§6 0-2§r feathers. §a+1§r for each level of looting. This will§c override§r data packs and§c disable§e rare drops§r.
Rabbits will§6 only§r drop§6 0-1§r rabbit hide. §a+1§r for each level of looting. This will§c override§r data packs and§c disable§e rare drops§r.
Stray skeletons will§6 only§r drop§6 0-2§r bones and/or arrows. §a+1§r for each level of looting. This will§c override§r data packs and§c disable§e rare drops§r.
Husk zombies will§6 only§r drop§6 0-2§r feathers. §a+1§r for each level of looting. This will§c override§r data packs and§c disable§e rare drops§r.
How fast the arrow will fire out of the bow when instant bow is enabled.
Bring back the old instant bow firing. This tweak will§c not work§r when a bow is in the§e off-hand§r.
Removes the timer that prevents continual left clicking.
Removes the experience bar from the HUD.
Show the provided alternative experience level text.
Change the corner where the alternative experience level text is shown.
Change the alternative level text. Use §b%v§r to insert the current experience level. Use §b%§r followed by a Minecraft color code to get formatting. For example, §b%4§r will make §4red§r.
Change the color of the percent value based on its range. For example, percentages of less than 20% will be§c red§r.
Show the provided alternative experience progress text.
Change the corner where the alternative experience progress text is shown.
Change the alternative progress text. Use §b%v§r to insert the current experience progress. Use §b%§r followed by a Minecraft color code to get formatting. For example, §b%4§r will make §4red§r.
Disables the spawning of experience orbs.
Disables the rendering of experience orbs.

Disables the ability for the player to sprint.

Only applied in§6 survival§r mode.

Disables the ability for the player to 'sprint swim' under water.

Only applied in§6 survival§r mode.
Immediately refill the player's air bubbles once the player is above water.
§aImmediately§r grow any block that accepts bone meal. This can§e only§r be applied to§d vanilla§r blocks.
Bring back the old fire spread and tick updates.
This is a very§4 dangerous§r tweak to enable. All flammable blocks will§6 ignite§r and§e spread fire§c aggressively§r regardless of difficulty.
Bring back the chance for flammable blocks to§b always§r stay on§6 fire§r when old fire is§a enabled§r.
Allows the player to interact with doors, trapdoors, and fence gates by left-clicking.
Allows the player to interact with levers by left-clicking.
Allows the player to interact with buttons by left-clicking.
Adds a chance for wheat seeds to pop out from tilled grass blocks.
Removes the hunger bar from the HUD.
Show the provided alternative hunger food text.
Change the corner where the alternative hunger food text is shown.
Change the alternative food text. Use §b%v§r to insert the amount of food left. Use §b%§r followed by a Minecraft color code to get formatting. For example, §b%4§r will make §4red§r.
Change the color of the food value based on its range. For example, food values of less than or equal to 2 will be§4 red§r.
Show the provided alternative hunger saturation text.
Change the corner where the alternative hunger saturation text is shown.
Change the color of the percent value based on its range. For example, percentages of less than 20% will be§c red§r.
Change the alternative saturation text. Use §b%v§r to insert the current hunger saturation. Use §b%§r followed by a Minecraft color code to get formatting. For example, §b%4§r will make §4red§r.

All consumed food will refill hearts instead of hunger. Foods that give effects will§c no longer do so§r and the§6 nutritional§r values of foods will change.

This will§c not§r impact modded foods.

Disables the ability to stack food. Foods that restore half a heart, like cookies, will stack up to 8.

This will§c not§r impact modded foods.
Disable the subtle animation that is applied to the arm when you look around.
Reverse the direction in which the arm sway animation moves.

Change the intensity of the arm sway animation with§a 100%§r being§a full sway§r,§e 50%§r being§e half sway§r, and§c 0%§r being§c no sway§r.

For a more intense sway, you can go up to§b 300%§r.
Bring back the old swing animations when breaking or placing.
Disable the swinging animation that occurs when dropping an item on the ground.
Reset the swing animation everytime the player attacks, regardless of whether the player is in the middle of a swing animation.
Disable the animation modifier that changes how fast an item will appear after a swing or change in slot.
Bring back the old logic that controls the animation that plays when an item in the player's hand changes.
Disable the disintegration animation and breaking sound that happens when a tool runs out of durability.
Disable the animation that occurs on a zombie's arms when the zombie becomes aggressive or attacks.
Disable the neutral skeleton arm positions and the animation that occurs when the skeleton becomes aggressive.
Bring back the old 'squishy' ghast charging animation.
Bring back the old walking animation where the player's body tilts to the side.
Remove the subtle animation that is applied to the arm and viewing distance when trying to move while colliding with a block.
A subtle animation that is applied to the arm and viewing distance when jumping or falling.
Hand, Arm, Distance, Background, Jumping, Falling
Bring back the old crouch animation that plays when the player sneaks while in creative.
Remove the smooth animation that is applied when sneaking. This will also bring back the old crouching eye height.
Tilt the camera towards the direction of received damage.
Randomizes camera tilting between left or right when receiving non-directional damage.
Disable the death fall-over animation for player entities.

The swing speed for tools. Like shovels and pickaxes.
The swing speed when a block is in the player's hand.
The swing speed of items that are not blocks, swords, or tools.

This value will override all other swing speeds when haste is applied.

§eSet this to §c-1§e to§c disable§e.

This value will override all other swing speeds when mining fatigue is applied.

§eSet this to §c-1§e to§c disable§e.

This value will override§e any§r swing speed that does not match the given number.

§eSet this to §c-1§e to§c disable§e.
